page.title: 11EGLWYS LLANNEFYDD CHURCH
page.content: The Church of{St Nefydd & St Mary}was built in the 16th century,but St Nefydd was here in the 6th century.The two bells are about a 100 years old and the date 1668 is engraved on the font.There is one stained glass window with pictures of St Mary,St Nefydd & St David on it. In olden days children had lessons in the church porch and many meetings were held there.The key to the lock is huge and over 300 years old.The roof and pews are oak and part of the floor is wood and part of it concrete.The Church was closed for 10 years but was re-opened in 1968 after Â£7000 was spent on renovations.A service, mainly English,is held every other Sunday at 3pm .The Vicar is also vicar of Henllan & Bylchau. {Catrin O'r Berain,}whose grandfather was Henry VII, is said to have been buried in the churchyard in 1591.
